show.title: Charlie's Angels (2000)
show.headline: It's Lucy Liu, our girl Drew, Cameron D, and Destiny

event.title: <show-title>Charlie's Angels (2000)</show-title>
event.headline: Diaz, Liu, and Barrymore in the reboot that launched a million queer fantasies
event.description:
“Good morning, angels!”

In the year 2000, we entered the dawn of a new age. Low-rise jeans riddled the landscape as far as the eye could see, camera phones shifted how society documented their lives, and “Oops…” Britney Spears “Did It Again” with the release of her multiplatinum second album. Amongst all these developments, music video director McG released his feature film directorial debut CHARLIE’S ANGELS. This reboot of the popular '70s television series is one of the most 2000s things ever to exist! Natalie, Dylan, and Alex (Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore, and Lucy Liu) are private investigators working for mysterious millionaire Charlie Townsend. When the trio is tasked to locate missing software developer Eric Knox, they find themselves wrapped up in a conspiracy of dizzying proportions. Vacillating between male gaze-centered cheesecake and action femme camp, CHARLIE’S ANGELS confused audiences and left them wondering who exactly the film was for. Reevaluation has reclaimed this “guilty pleasure” as a piece of sapphic gateway cinema that introduced millions to the pleasures of goofy women kicking ass and being something “a little more than friends.” Like, these women are in a polycule – there's no question of that – and their flirty relationship is the highlight of the film. Featuring absurd gravity (and logic)-defying wire work, dozens of ridiculous disguises, a bizarre performance from Crispin Glover, and a trio of leads having a blast together, CHARLIE’S ANGELS is a wild great time at the movies. See you at the cinema, angels!

show.title: Pride & Prejudice (2005)
show.headline: Sometimes the last person you want to be with is the one you cannot be without

event.title: <show-title>Pride & Prejudice (2005)</show-title> <event-type-title>20th Anniversary Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Sometimes the last person you want to be with is the one you cannot be without
event.description:
One of the greatest love stories of all time, PRIDE & PREJUDICE, returns to the screen. When Elizabeth Bennet (Keira Knightley) meets the handsome Mr. Darcy (Matthew MacFadyen), she believes he is the last man on earth she could ever marry. But as their lives become intertwined in an unexpected adventure, she finds herself captivated by the very person she swore to loathe for all eternity. Based on the beloved masterpiece by Jane Austen, it is the classic tale of love and misunderstanding that sparkles with romance, wit, and emotional force.

Your ticket includes the following props:

  • Embroidered handkerchief
  • Lotion
  • Three postcards
  • Stationary
  • Potato keychain

show.title: Vampire Hunter D (Subtitled)
show.headline: Hunting vampires in a post-apocalyptic world

event.title: <show-title>Vampire Hunter D (Subtitled)</show-title> <event-type-title>AXCN 40th Anniversary</event-type-title>
event.headline: Presented by Anime Expo Cinema Nights
event.description:
Presented in Japanese with English subtitles

Anime Expo Cinema Nights presents a special 40th-anniversary screening of the cult classic VAMPIRE HUNTER D. Audiences will be treated to a special introduction to the film by HIDIVE's Star Butler and Shudder's head of programming, Sam Zimmerman.

In the year 12,090 AD, technology and the supernatural have overtaken the world, leaving the land desolate and despotic. The remnants of humanity are scattered into small communities and live in fear of vampires who compose the ruling nobility. When Count Magnus Lee tastes the blood of Doris Lang, she is forcibly chosen to be his next wife. In an effort to escape her ill-gotten fate, she hires a mysterious vampire hunter known only as D, who comes from a peculiar lineage.

show.title: A Minecraft Movie
show.headline: A star-studded cast crafts up a crazy adventure in a new kind of block-buster

event.title: <show-title>A Minecraft Movie</show-title> <event-type-title>Family Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Get ready to craft your world at our interactive family party
event.description:
Welcome to the world of Minecraft, where creativity doesn’t just help you craft, it’s essential to one’s survival! Four misfits – Garrett “The Garbage Man” Garrison (Jason Momoa, AQUAMAN), Henry (Sebastian Eugene Hansen, JUST MERCY), Natalie (Emma Myers, Wednesday), and Dawn (Danielle Brooks, Peacemaker) – find themselves struggling with ordinary problems when they are suddenly pulled through a mysterious portal into the Overworld, a bizarre, cubic wonderland that thrives on imagination. To get back home, they’ll have to master this world (and protect it from evil things like Piglins and Zombies, too) while embarking on a magical quest with an unexpected, expert crafter, Steve (Jack Black, SCHOOL OF ROCK). Together, their adventure will challenge all five to be bold and to reconnect with the qualities that make each of them uniquely creative…the very skills they need to thrive back in the real world.

Your ticket comes with the following props:

  • Weapon keychain
  • Diamond gel cube
  • Face mask and crayons

show.title: Lost Highway
show.headline: We've met before, haven't we?

show.title: Jumanji (1995)
show.headline: Roll the dice and unleash the excitement!

event.title: <show-title>Jumanji (1995)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Roll the dice and unleash the excitement at our interactive movie party!
event.description:
Two kids get way more than they bargain for when they sit down to play a seemingly innocent jungle-themed board game. Robin Williams and eye-popping, effects-driven adventure ensue.

See, the game Jumanji is a magical one. By playing it, the two inadvertently release Alan Parrish (Robin Williams), a man who’s been trapped inside the game ever since he was a boy 26 years ago. But soon after reentering the real world, Alan is forced to play the game again. But this time, the mischievous game sets the creatures of the jungle loose on the city. Now, Alan and the kids must stop the mayhem and get those rampaging animals back in the box.

Good luck with all that, kids.

Your ticket includes the following props:

  • Animal dice
  • Custom wooden player token
  • Monkey tail
  • Branded hand drum
  • Acrylic keychain designed like the crystal ball in the center of the game board

show.title: Shrek
show.headline: The greatest fairy tale never told

event.title: <show-title>Shrek</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: The greatest fairy tale never told
event.description:
When a green ogre called Shrek discovers his swamp has been "swamped" with all sorts of fairytale creatures by the scheming Lord Farquaad, Shrek sets out, with a very loud donkey by his side, to persuade Farquaad to give his swamp back. Instead, a deal is made. Farquaad, who wants to become the king, sends Shrek to rescue Princess Fiona, who is waiting for her one true love. But once they head back with Fiona, it starts to become apparent that not only does Shrek like Fiona, but Fiona is keeping something secret.

Your ticket comes with the following props:

  • Ogre ears
  • Onion keychain
  • Eye-pop bird
  • Smell-along card

show.title: The Hunger Games
show.headline: May the odds be ever in your favor

event.title: <show-title>The Hunger Games</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: May the odds be ever in your favor at our interactive movie party
event.description:
Every year in the ruins of what was once North America, the evil Capitol of the nation of Panem forces each of its 12 districts to send a teenage boy and girl to compete in the Hunger Games. A twisted punishment for a past uprising and an ongoing government intimidation tactic, the Hunger Games are a nationally televised event in which "Tributes" must fight with one another until one survivor remains. Pitted against highly-trained Tributes who have prepared for these Games their entire lives, Katniss (Jennifer Lawrence) is forced to rely upon her sharp instincts, as well as the mentorship of drunken former victor Haymitch Abernathy (Woody Harrelson). If she's ever to return home to District 12, Katniss must make impossible choices in the arena that weighs survival against humanity and life against love.

Your ticket includes the following props:

  • Matchbook
  • Seneca Crane beard tattoo
  • Nightlock berry snacks
  • Mini bow and arrow

show.title: Jaws (1975)
show.headline: Steven Spielberg's terrifying creature feature

event.title: <show-title>Jaws (1975)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: A bigger boatload of bite-y fun
event.description:
“This shark, swallow you whole.”

Duh, nuh…duh, nuh…nothing quite says "ah, summer" like watching an elusive giant shark terrorize Amity Island on the big screen. It’s the movie that perfected the summer blockbuster and launched a million toothy (and goofy) knock-offs, but none of them can compete with the bite of Spielberg’s 1975 original. This bona fide American classic has everything you could want from a movie: kids in peril, drunken sea shanties, and Richard Dreyfuss in a cage.

As if that wasn’t enough, this is a Movie Party, so you can live the shark-hunting adventure along with your pals Brody, Hooper, and Quint – minus the salty sea air and actual mortal peril. Featuring shark hats, yellow floatie drink holders (CAUTION: very susceptible to shark attacks), and a boat-shaped bath bomb with a great white shark in the center, it’s the most fourth-wall-busting fun you can have on dry land.

show.title: Marie Antoinette (2006)
show.headline: Kirsten Dunst checks into this tender & opulent emotional epic

show.title: A Night to Dismember
show.headline: Doris Wishman’s horror dreamscape

event.title: <show-title>A Night to Dismember</show-title>
event.headline: Doris Wishman’s horror dreamscape.
event.description:
Vicki Kent (Samantha Fox) has just been released from a mental hospital five years after supposedly stabbing two neighborhood boys to death. Her sister Mary (Diane Cummins) and brother Billy (Bill Szarka) think Vicki should still be locked up, and the two soon begin tormenting her in the hopes of triggering another psychotic episode. But when various members of Vicki’s extended family begin turning up dead, is she actually the one responsible for the carnage?

The first all-out horror film by legendary filmmaker Doris Wishman, A Night to Dismember famously had to be salvaged after a majority of its original camera negative was destroyed in a lab fire during post-production. The final film, constructed a combination of old and new material plus copious outtakes and stock footage, is singularly strange head-scratcher and a masterpiece of accidental avant-garde.

DCP courtesy of Distribpix and Muscle Distribution

show.title: Critters 2: The Main Course
show.headline: Get ready for seconds!

event.title: <show-title>Critters 2: The Main Course</show-title>
event.headline: Get ready for seconds!
event.description:
The denizens of Grover’s Bend must again band together to face the razor-toothed onslaught of the star-born Crites! But now the meat-seeking spherical beasteroids have multiplied and learned some new tactics for mass ingestion. These mangy malevolent muppets are larger and trickier than before, and though they've discovered the pleasures of fast food and live cattle, humans are still at the top of their grocery list. Earth’s fate lies in the hands of a melon-headed teenager, a fat ex-sheriff, a bucktoothed drunk, and two shape-shifting galactic bounty hunters named Ug and Lee. Look for Hollywood’s ultimate meganerd, Eddie Deezen, in the role of "Hungry Heifer Manager."

And don’t be fooled by the PG-13 rating -- this installment features much heavier doses of nudity, profanity and manic, outrageous violence, including a mutilated policeman in a pink Easter bunny suit crashing through a stained glass church window into the laps of grandmas and children. Take that, God. (Zack Carlson)

DCP courtesy of Warner Bros.

show.title: Demons (1985)
show.headline: A magnificent goreblast from producer Dario Argento

event.title: <show-title>Demons (1985)</show-title>
event.headline: The magnificent Italian goreblast
event.description: Welcome to the most life-enriching Italian terror-party of 1985. Produced by Dario Argento (SUSPIRIA) and directed by Lamberto Bava, DEMONS follows a panorama of punks, preppies, and ne'er-do-wells as they get trapped in a movie theater and possessed by gut-shredding Satanic demonoids. Featuring songs by Mötley Crüe and Billy Idol, gloopy effects, and the iconic Geretta Geretta in a lead role, this is the most fun you'll ever have in a movie theater while watching a movie about beasties on the loose in a movie theater.

show.title: The Brides of Dracula (1960)
show.headline: Peter Cushing's Van Helsing brings the Hammer.

event.title: <show-title>The Brides of Dracula (1960)</show-title>
event.headline: Peter Cushing's Van Helsing brings the Hammer.
event.description:
Marianne (Yvonne Monlaur), a beautiful young girl, is stranded en route to a teaching assignment in Eastern Europe. She is persuaded to spend the night at the nearly deserted castle of the mysterious Baroness Meinster (Martita Hunt). In the castle, Marianne accidentally discovers a man chained to the wall in his room. The Baroness explains only that he is her "sick and feeble-minded" son. Unable to get any further information from her or the maid, Marianne steals a key and sets him free. But once unbound, the man – Baron Meinster (David Peel) – fiendishly recruits the undead for his evil purposes while Marianne and Dr. Van Helsing (Peter Cushing) try to stop him in this classic Hammer Film. (Shout! Factory)

SF: 35mm print courtesy of Universal Pictures

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Cell
show.headline: J-Lo at her most stunning in Tarsem's lush and dangerous thriller.

event.title: <show-title>The Cell</show-title>
event.headline: J-Lo at her most stunning in Tarsem's lush and dangerous thriller.
event.description:
If a horror movie took place inside of the music video for Nirvana’s “Heart-Shaped Box,” it would feel a lot like THE CELL. Psychologist Catherine Deane (Jennifer Lopez) has developed an experimental virtual reality treatment for coma patients. But when she enters the brain of a comatose serial killer (Vincent D'Onofrio, Daredevil), Deane melts into a terrifying dreamscape that short-circuits her life. Directed by Indian filmmaker Tarsem Singh and featuring gorgeous costume design from Eiko Ishioka (BRAM STOKER’S DRACULA), THE CELL is an acid-drenched spectacle that should only ever be experienced on the big screen. (Joseph A. Ziemba)

DCP courtesy of Warner Bros.

show.title: Tremors
show.headline: The Bacon sizzles in this all-time creature feature

show.title: Twin Peaks: Fire Walk with Me
show.headline: David Lynch's surrealist fever dream

landscapeHeroImage.altText: TWIN PEAKS: FIRE WALK WITH ME

portraitHeroImage.altText: TWIN PEAKS: FIRE WALK WITH ME

posterImages.altText: TWIN PEAKS: FIRE WALK WITH ME

show.title: A History of Violence
show.headline: Tom Stall had the perfect life... until he became a hero.

event.title: <show-title>A History of Violence</show-title>
event.headline: Sorry kids, your dad’s a cold blooded killer.
event.description:
David Cronenberg’s foray into crime drama finds him grafting his concerns about identity, transformation, and family onto the basic plot elements of its source graphic novel. With a stacked cast of veteran actors, and gallons of fake blood and gore, A HISTORY OF VIOLENCE shows Cronenberg has not lost an ounce of his mastery of taut interpersonal drama and thrilling genre spectacle. Fun facts: this was the last Hollywood studio film released on VHS in the U.S. and it was loosely remade in India in 2003 as LEO! (Laird Jimenez)

35mm courtesy of Park Circus

show.title: Cosmopolis
show.headline: Don DeLillo & David Cronenberg predict the future.

event.title: <show-title>Cosmopolis</show-title>
event.headline: Don DeLillo & David Cronenberg predict the future.
event.description:
Unfolding over a single cataclysmic day, a 28-year-old billionaire asset manager rides his tricked-out limo to get a haircut. Over the course of his journey, intimate encounters, grid-locked traffic and the death of a rap star contribute to his reality melting away. (MUBI)

DCP courtesy of Lionsgate

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Eastern Promises
show.headline: David Cronenberg & Viggo Mortensen explore the brutal world of the Russian mob

event.title: <show-title>Eastern Promises</show-title>
event.headline: David Cronenberg & Viggo Mortensen explore the brutal world of the Russian mob
event.description:
Though they teamed up in 2005 for A HISTORY OF VIOLENCE, director David Cronenberg and star Viggo Mortensen's follow-up feature may very well have been deserving of that title. Following the death of a teenager in London, a midwife (Naomi Watts) pulls at the threads of a mystery that lead her into the thralls of the Russian mafia, and their fixer Nikolai (Mortensen). Known for its bare-knuckle, bare-all bathhouse fight, EASTERN PROMISES examines how a world of brutality and moral corruption can be as terrifying as Cronenberg's more outright body horror thrillers.

DCP courtesy of Universal Pictures

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Godzilla vs. Megalon
show.headline: GIANT AGAINST GIANT...the ultimate battle!

event.title: <show-title>Godzilla vs. Megalon</show-title>
event.headline: “Giant against giant…the ultimate battle!”
event.description:
Facing total destruction as an accidental result of nuclear weapons tests in the Pacific Ocean, the undersea kingdom of Seatopia sends its god (a bomb-spitting giant cockroach with drill arms named Megalon) and the evil interstellar monster Gigan (a reptilian goose with a buzzsaw embedded in its chest and hook hands) to wage war against the surface. Will Godzilla and Jet Jaguar (an experimental robot created by a plucky inventor, his best friend, and his annoying kid brother) be able to save the day?

Oft decried as being the nadir of the original Showa series (it’s not), GODZILLA VS. MEGALON is an incredible showcase of miniature effects and creative reuse of footage that culminates with one of the most satisfying tag-team kaiju battle royales ever filmed – not to mention an earworm theme song that’ll be stuck in your head for weeks. (Elizabeth Purchell)

Austin: 35mm print courtesy of the University of North Carolina School of the Arts
Raleigh: DCP courtesy of Janus Films

show.title: Maps to the Stars
show.headline: Burn, hollywood, burn.

event.title: <show-title>Maps to the Stars</show-title>
event.headline: Burn, hollywood, burn.
event.description:
Troubled Hollywood actress Havana Segrand is considering a career-boosting return playing her own mother, also a legendary film star. Her analyst Stafford Weiss's son Benji is a spoiled, multimillionaire child star, recently returned to public life following a spell in rehab. When Havana hires unknown Agatha as her new assistant on her friend Carrie Fisher's personal recommendation, it reveals dangerous secrets that they would all prefer to keep buried. Dark satire from acclaimed director David Cronenberg. (BBC Two)

DCP courtesy of Universal Pictures

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Running Man (1987)
show.headline: The life-or-death game show event of future past

event.title: <show-title>The Running Man (1987)</show-title>
event.headline: The life-or-death game show event of future past
event.description:
2019 was a rough year: an oppressive government, food shortages, censorship, riots...at least we had some good quality TV! Set in (semi-)fictional 2019, the titular Running Man of 1987’s THE RUNNING MAN is a long-running game show that pits prisoners in mortal combat up against a variety of meatheads. If they win: freedom. If they lose: death! When Ben "The Butcher of Bakersfield" Richards (Arnold Schwarzenegger!) plays the game, expect some arterial spray and a whole lotta genuine LAFFS! The one-liners flow like water as this mountain of muscle tears through the gargantuan foes whose personas include a hockey-playing professor, an electric opera singer, and a power tool dad. Based on a story by Stephen King (alias Richard Bachman), there's some very blunt media satire and social commentary, but we'll probably all be too busy cheering for more mayhem to notice. This violent and legitimately funny sci-fi action romp is an underrated classic of the '80s. Co-starring actual game show host Richard Dawson, the future governor of Minnesota Jesse Ventura, Yaphet Kotto, and Jim Brown!

See it now before Edgar Wright’s remake comes out later this year!

show.title: It Follows
show.headline: The less you know about IT FOLLOWS, the better.

event.title: <show-title>It Follows</show-title>
event.headline: It doesn't think. It doesn't feel. It doesn't give up.
event.description: We don't just watch horror movies — we live for them. And at every Terror Tuesday, we join hands to worship at the gore-soaked altar of slash, trash, thrash, and FUN!! This eclectic series spans all centuries, covering everything from seminal horror treasures to undiscovered D.I.Y. monster-blasts. Terror Tuesday is the new ground zero for warming your black heart.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Slumber Party Massacre
show.headline: A drop-dead masterpiece of subversive trash-horror.

event.title: <show-title>The Slumber Party Massacre</show-title>
event.description:
Amy Holden Jones turned down an editing job on E.T. to direct this movie! She made the right choice.

Written as a commentary on the inherent sexism of slashers by feminist icon Rita Mae Brown — but filmed completely straight — THE SLUMBER PARTY MASSACRE is a terrific inside joke that also delivers the goods as a skid row photocopy of HALLOWEEN, complete with a killer who’s figuratively castrated when the tip of his power drill is hacked off.

With its stylized photography, plot points involving pizza and an endlessly cool homemade synth score, THE SLUMBER PARTY MASSACRE is a drop-dead masterpiece of subversive trash-horror.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: Baby Day Show
sessionAttributes.description: For our baby day shows, we keep the lights up a bit, and the sound down a bit, so your little one never has to know they even went to the movies!
